titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the LeRoy Scott Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 4, 2019 at 03:39

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bolerium Books on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2011.
May 2011 Acquisition: gift of Bolerium Books.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The LeRoy Scott Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: LeRoy Scott Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: LeRoy Scott
bioghist.p: LeRoy Scott (1917-2009) was a gay rights activist and cross dressing performer who used the drag name "Madame X."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, journal, photographs, printed material and other papers by or relating to LeRoy Scott. Includes papers relating to the Corduroy Club and the Mattachine Society.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: March 2011 Acquisition; April 2011 Acquisition; and May 2011 Acquisition.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bolerium Books on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2011.
